name: 陳怡倩
objective: Main objective of this course is to guide students to formulate, organize, and present ideas clearly and logically in well-formed paragraphs and essays. Students shall expand their writing capacity through brainstorming, outlining, drafting, paraphrasing, synthesizing, revising, and editing writing activities.
schedule:
Week 1	Course Introduction
Week 2	Paragraph Writing: Comparing or Contrasting I
Week 3	Paragraph Writing: Comparing or Contrasting II
Week 4	Peer Review: Comparing or Contrasting
Week 5	Sentence Variety I
Week 6	Sentence Variety II
Week 7	Paragraph Writing: Explaining I
Week 8	Paragraph Writing: Explaining II
Week 9	Peer Review: Explaining
Week 10	Creative Writing I
Week 11	Creative Writing II
Week 12	Peer Review: Creative Writing
Week 13	Readability: Sentence Flow I
Week 14	Readability: Sentence Flow II
Week 15	Essay Writing: Cause and Effect I
Week 16	Essay Writing: Cause and Effect II
Week 17	Peer Review: Cause and Effect
Week 18	Final Exam
scorePolicy: Attendance & Participation (15%); Class Activities (15%); Pop Quizzes (20%); Assignments (40%), Final (10%).
materials:
Required Textbooks:
Donald, Robert B., Morrow, Betty R., Wargetz, Lillian G., & Werner, Kathleen. (1995). Writing Clear Essays (3rd). Upper Saddle River, NJ: Prentice Hall.
Donald, Robert B., Moore, James D., Morrow, Betty R., Wargetz, Lillian G., & Werner, Kathleen. (1998). Writing Clear Paragraphs (6th). Upper Saddle River, NJ: Prentice Hall.
References:
Azar, Betty S. (1998.) Understanding and Using English Grammar (3rd). White Plains, NY: Pearson Education.
Butler, Eugenia, Hickman, Mary A., McAlexander, Patricia J., & Overby, Lalla. (1995). Correct Writing (6th). Lexington, MA: D. C. Health and Company.
Frank, Marcella. (2003). Modern English Part II: Sentences & Complex Structures (2nd). Taipei, Taiwan: Pearson Education Taiwan.
Frank, Marcella. (1986). Modern English Part I: Exercise for Non-native Speakers. Englewood Cliffs, NJ: Prentice Hall Regents.
